info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 6 at 8:39AM CDT until June 8 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
Little River near Tecumseh affecting Pottawatomie and Seminole Counties.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Little River near Tecumseh.
* WHEN...From this morning to early Sunday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Low-lying croplands... pastures... and rural roads may experience shallow flooding or be isolated by deeper water in overflow channels cutting across the flood plain. The area affected is entirely rural... and downstream of Lake Thunderbird... from near Macomb in Pottawatomie County to near Bowlegs in western Seminole County.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CDT Friday the stage was 7.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The Little River is expected to rise to a crest of 10.8 feet this afternoon. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING
